sentence.Network_en: Elaborate efforts were made to reconstruct what had happened.
sentence.Network_cn: 为重现当时的情景，他们做了大量细致的工作。

sentence.Network_en: He had plastic surgery to help reconstruct his badly damaged face.
sentence.Network_cn: 他做了整形手术以修复其严重受伤的面部。

sentence.Network_en: She actually wanted to reconstruct the state and transform society.
sentence.Network_cn: 她实际上想要重建国家，改造社会。

entry.def: If you reconstruct something that has been destroyed or badly damaged, you build it and make it work again.

example.ex: The government must reconstruct the shattered economy...
example.tran: 政府必须重建支离破碎的经济。

example.ex: He had plastic surgery to help reconstruct his badly damaged face...
example.tran: 他做了整形手术以修复其严重受伤的面部。

entry.def: To reconstruct a system or policy means to change it so that it works in a different way.

example.ex: She actually wanted to reconstruct the state and transform society...
example.tran: 她实际上想要重建国家，改造社会。

example.ex: It is important to think about how these institutions might be reconstructed in our own societies.
example.tran: 重要的是，要想想在我们自己的社会里如何对这些机构进行改造。

entry.tran: 使（过去的事件）重现，使再现
entry.def: If you reconstruct an event that happened in the past, you try to get a complete understanding of it by combining a lot of small pieces of information.

example.ex: He began to reconstruct the events of 21 December 1988, when flight 103 disappeared...
example.tran: 他开始再现1988年12月21日的103次航班失踪事件。

example.ex: Elaborate efforts were made to reconstruct what had happened.
example.tran: 为重现当时的情景，他们做了大量细致的工作。

sentences.sentence: "The house was rebuild after it was hit by a bomb"

means.word_mean: 3. cause somebody to adapt or reform socially or politically
4. return to its original or usable and functioning condition;

sentences.sentence: "restore the forest to its original pristine condition"

means.word_mean: 5. do over, as of (part of) a house;

stems_affixes.word_buile: de去掉,变坏+struct建立,结构→adj.破坏的 n.故意或有计划的破坏 v.破坏

stems_affixes.value_cn: 可破坏的, 易毁坏的
stems_affixes.word_buile: destruct破坏+ible能……的→adj.可破坏的, 易毁坏的
destruct破坏+ive……的→adj.破坏性
industry工业, 产业+ial……的→industrial
industry勤奋+ious..的→industrious
instruct[v.教,教授;命令,指示]+ive表形容词→adj.有益的, 教育性的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 仪器的;器械的;乐器的;起作用的;有帮助的
stems_affixes.word_buile: instrument[n.工具,仪器,器械;乐器]+al……的→adj.仪器的;器械的;乐器的;起作用的;有帮助的
obstruct[v.阻隔,阻塞[道路,通道等]n.阻碍物,障碍物]+ion表名词→n.妨碍,障碍物

stems_affixes.value_cn: 建造,构造;建筑物,结构;释义,解释
stems_affixes.word_buile: construct[v.建设,建造,构造;创立]+ion表名词→n.建造,构造;建筑物,结构;释义,解释
de去掉,变坏+struct建立,结构→adj.破坏的 n.故意或有计划的破坏 v.破坏
destruct破坏+ion表名词→弄坏结构→破坏

stems_affixes.value_cn: 工业, 产业, 行业, 勤奋
stems_affixes.word_buile: indu=in+str=struct建立,结构+y→n.工业, 产业, 行业, 勤奋
instruct[v.教,教授;命令,指示]+ion表名词→n.教授;指导;[n.]用法说明[书],操作指南
instruct[v.教,教授;命令,指示]+or人→n.指导者,教员
in内+stru=struct建立,结构+ment物→内部构造→仪器,工具
instrumental[adj.仪器的;器械的;乐器的;起作用的;有帮助的]+ity性质→n.手段
ob反+struct建立,结构→反建设→阻塞,阻碍
struct建立,结构+ure表名词→n.结构,构造;建筑物 v.构造,建造

stems_affixes.value_cn: 基础,下部结构,地下建筑
stems_affixes.word_buile: sub下面+struct建立,结构+ion表名词→建造在下面
super上面+structure结构→上面的结构→上层建筑
con共同+struct建立,结构→共同建立→建设,建造
de坏+stroy=struct建立,结构→v.破坏,摧毁,消灭
de去掉,变坏+struct建立,结构→adj.破坏的 n.故意或有计划的破坏 v.破坏
in进+struct建立,结构→把知识建立进去→指导,指示
ob反+struct建立,结构→反建设→阻塞,阻碍
re再+construct[v.建设,建造,构造;创立]→v.重建,再建;重现,再现
struct建立,结构+ure表名词→n.结构,构造;建筑物 v.构造,建造

Sentence.sentence: Modern airplanes have two black boxes: a voice recorder, which tracks pilots' conversations,and a flight-data recorder, which monitors fuel levels, engine noises and other operating functions that help investigators reconstruct the aircraft's final moments.
There is an urgent need for them to be reconstructed.

sentences.en: They’ve decided to reconstruct this building.
sentences.cn: 他们决定重建这栋大楼。

sentences.en: We had no computer backup and had to rely on old paper files to reconstruct the records.
sentences.cn: 我们没有计算机备份,只得靠落后的纸档案重做记录。

sentences.en: The police managed to piece together the jigsaw and reconstruct the victim’s last hours.
sentences.cn: 警方成功地将线索拼在一起，重现了受害人生前最后几个小时的情况。

sentences.en: Every aspect of the original has been closely studied and painstakingly reconstructed.
sentences.cn: 原作的每一细节都经过了仔细研究，费尽苦心才得以重现。

sentences.en: It is not possible to reconstruct the complete symphony from these manuscript sketches.
sentences.cn: 想要通过这些手写草稿恢复这一交响乐的全貌是不可能的。

sentences.en: Local historians have reconstructed from contemporary descriptions how the hall may have looked in 1300.
sentences.cn: 根据同时期的描述，当地历史学家再现了1300 年时这座礼堂的可能面貌。
